pr_title: [QS-9-10] Reject attestations that fail ancestry condition

timeline.message: Reject attestations that fail ancestry condition

timeline.bodyText:
BTW can't it be the concurrency case when recentChainData updates its finalized checkpoint between calls recentChainData.getFinalizedEpoch() and recentChainData.getFinalizedCheckpoint()?
May be get recentChainData.getFinalizedCheckpoint() once into local var to be certainly safe on this?
timeline.author: Nashatyrev
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -191,6 +191,21 @@ private InternalValidationResult singleAttestationChecks(final Attestation attes
                 return REJECT;
               }
 
+              // The current finalized_checkpoint is an ancestor of the block defined by
+              // aggregate.data.beacon_block_root
+              if (!forkChoiceUtilWrapper
+                  .get_ancestor(
+                      recentChainData.getForkChoiceStrategy().orElseThrow(),
+                      data.getBeacon_block_root(),
+                      compute_start_slot_at_epoch(recentChainData.getFinalizedEpoch()))
+                  .map(
+                      ancestorOfLMDVote ->
+                          ancestorOfLMDVote.equals(
+                              recentChainData.getFinalizedCheckpoint().orElseThrow().getRoot()))

replies.bodyText: Good point. Will make the change.
replies.author: cemozerr
